intro: Draba tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, rounded seed pods that release seeds when mature. Draba tucumanensis is notable for its resilience and adaptation to harsh mountainous climates.
